intro: Sticherus boliviensis, commonly known as the Bolivian sticherus, is a species of liverwort found in the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the family Peltasporaceae and is characterized by its small, leafy structure with a distinctive thallus. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as rock crevices or forest floors. It has a simple morphology with a prostrate or ascending growth habit. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and specialized member of the liverwort flora.
